verses.kjv: And there was a man of mount Ephraim, whose name was Micah.
verses.web: There was a man of the hill country of Ephraim, whose name was Micah.
verses.ct: There was a man named Micah who lived in the hill country of Ephraim.

verses.kjv: And he said unto his mother, The eleven hundred shekels of silver that were taken from thee, about which thou cursedst, and spakest of also in mine ears, behold, the silver is with me; I took it. And his mother said, Blessed be thou of the LORD, my son.
verses.web: He said to his mother, “The eleven hundred pieces of silver that were taken from you, about which you uttered a curse, and also spoke it in my ears—behold, the silver is with me. I took it.” His mother said, “May LORD bless my son!”
verses.ct: He told his mother, "Remember the 1,100 shekels of silver that were stolen from you? You pronounced a curse about it, and I heard you say it. Well, I'm the one who took it — I have the silver." His mother replied, "May the LORD bless you, my son!"

verses.kjv: And when he had restored the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother, his mother said, I had wholly dedicated the silver unto the LORD from my hand for my son, to make a graven image and a molten image: now therefore I will restore it unto thee.
verses.web: He restored the eleven hundred pieces of silver to his mother, then his mother said, “I most certainly dedicate the silver to LORD from my hand for my son, to make a carved image and a molten image. Now therefore I will restore it to you.”
verses.ct: When he returned the 1,100 shekels of silver to his mother, she said, "I had already dedicated this silver to the LORD on your behalf, to have a carved image and a cast idol made from it. So now I'm giving it back to you for that purpose."

verses.kjv: Yet he restored the money unto his mother; and his mother took two hundred shekels of silver, and gave them to the founder, who made thereof a graven image and a molten image: and they were in the house of Micah.
verses.web: When he restored the money to his mother, his mother took two hundred pieces of silver, and gave them to a silversmith, who made a carved image and a molten image out of it. It was in the house of Micah.
verses.ct: But when he handed the money back to his mother, she took only 200 shekels of silver and gave them to a silversmith, who used them to make a carved image and a cast idol. These were placed in Micah's house.

verses.kjv: And the man Micah had an house of gods, and made an ephod, and teraphim, and consecrated one of his sons, who became his priest.
verses.web: The man Micah had a house of gods, and he made an ephod, and teraphim, and consecrated one of his sons, who became his priest.
verses.ct: Micah had set up his own shrine. He made an ephod and some household idols, and he appointed one of his own sons to serve as his priest.

verses.kjv: In those days there was no king in Israel, but every man did that which was right in his own eyes.
verses.web: In those days there was no king in Israel. Everyone did that which was right in his own eyes.
verses.ct: In those days Israel had no king, so everyone did whatever they thought was right.

verses.kjv: And there was a young man out of Bethlehemjudah of the family of Judah, who was a Levite, and he sojourned there.
verses.web: There was a young man out of Bethlehem Judah, of the family of Judah, who was a Levite; and he lived there.
verses.ct: Now there was a young man from Bethlehem in Judah, from the tribe of Judah, who was a Levite living there.

verses.kjv: And the man departed out of the city from Bethlehemjudah to sojourn where he could find a place: and he came to mount Ephraim to the house of Micah, as he journeyed.
verses.web: The man departed out of the city, out of Bethlehem Judah, to live where he could find a place, and he came to the hill country of Ephraim, to the house of Micah, as he traveled.
verses.ct: This man left Bethlehem in Judah to find somewhere else to settle. During his travels, he arrived at Micah's house in the hill country of Ephraim.

verses.kjv: And Micah said unto him, Whence comest thou? And he said unto him, I am a Levite of Bethlehemjudah, and I go to sojourn where I may find a place.
verses.web: Micah said to him, “Where did you come from?” He said to him, “I am a Levite of Bethlehem Judah, and I am looking for a place to live.”
verses.ct: Micah asked him, "Where are you coming from?" The man answered, "I'm a Levite from Bethlehem in Judah, and I'm looking for a place to settle down."

verses.kjv: And Micah said unto him, Dwell with me, and be unto me a father and a priest, and I will give thee ten shekels of silver by the year, and a suit of apparel, and thy victuals. So the Levite went in.
verses.web: Micah said to him, “Dwell with me, and be to me a father and a priest, and I will give you ten pieces of silver per year, a suit of clothing, and your food.” So the Levite went in.
verses.ct: Micah said to him, "Stay here with me. Be my spiritual father and priest, and I'll pay you 10 shekels of silver a year, plus a set of clothes and your meals." So the Levite agreed and went in.

verses.kjv: And the Levite was content to dwell with the man; and the young man was unto him as one of his sons.
verses.web: The Levite was content to dwell with the man; and the young man was to him as one of his sons.
verses.ct: The Levite was happy to stay with Micah, and Micah treated the young man like one of his own sons.

verses.kjv: And Micah consecrated the Levite; and the young man became his priest, and was in the house of Micah.
verses.web: Micah consecrated the Levite, and the young man became his priest, and was in the house of Micah.
verses.ct: Micah officially appointed the Levite as his priest, and the young man served in that role, living in Micah's house.

verses.kjv: Then said Micah, Now know I that the LORD will do me good, seeing I have a Levite to my priest.
verses.web: Then Micah said, “Now I know that LORD will do good to me, since I have a Levite as my priest.”
verses.ct: Then Micah said, "Now I know the LORD will be good to me, because I have a Levite serving as my priest."
